com.ibm.async_util.locks

Interface ObservableEpoch


  • public interface ObservableEpoch
    A concurrency mechanism which maintains a period of activity -- an epoch -- during which participants may successfully enter it, that later can be terminated. After an epoch is terminated, new entrants are rejected from entering but the terminator waits for any remaining participants to exit

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  ObservableEpoch.EpochToken
      A token signifying successful entry in the active epoch.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CompletionStage<Void> awaitCompletion()
      Waits for the epoch to complete, returning a future that triggers after the epoch has been terminated and all participants have exited.
      Optional<ObservableEpoch.EpochToken> enter()
      Attempt to secure a position in the active epoch, failing if it has already been terminated.
      boolean isTerminated()
      Returns true if this epoch has been terminated.
      static ObservableEpoch newEpoch() 
      static ObservableEpoch newTerminatedEpoch() 
      CompletionStage<Boolean> terminate()
      Atomically ends the active epoch, preventing new entrants from successfully entering and returning a CompletionStage that triggers once all active participants have exited.

    • Method Detail

      • enter

        Optional<ObservableEpoch.EpochToken> enter()
        Attempt to secure a position in the active epoch, failing if it has already been terminated.
        Returns:
        an Optional populated with an ObservableEpoch.EpochToken associated with the active epoch if it has not been terminated. Otherwise, returns an empty Optional

      • terminate

        CompletionStage<Boolean> terminate()
        Atomically ends the active epoch, preventing new entrants from successfully entering and returning a CompletionStage that triggers once all active participants have exited.
        Returns:
        a CompletionStage, which will complete after the last open ObservableEpoch.EpochToken has been closed. The value of the future will be false if this epoch was already terminated, otherwise true for the single call that terminates this epoch

      • isTerminated

        boolean isTerminated()
        Returns true if this epoch has been terminated. This boolean does not indicate whether all active participants have exited the epoch, only whether the terminate() method has been called and subsequent entrants will be rejected
        Returns:
        true iff this epoch has been terminated

      • awaitCompletion

        CompletionStage<Void> awaitCompletion()
        Waits for the epoch to complete, returning a future that triggers after the epoch has been terminated and all participants have exited. Note that this method does not terminate the epoch itself -- new entrants may enter and exit freely after this method is called, and a separate call to terminate() must be made before this returned future completes
        Returns:
        a CompletionStage which will complete after a call to terminate() has been made, and the last open ObservableEpoch.EpochToken has been closed.

      • newEpoch

        static ObservableEpoch newEpoch()
        Returns:
        a new ObservableEpoch instance

      • newTerminatedEpoch

        static ObservableEpoch newTerminatedEpoch()
        Returns:
        a new ObservableEpoch instance which is already terminated. This is useful for initializing an epoch to something that isn't null, but won't allow anyone to enter it.
